Name: Baseline
Description:
Baseline
This example demonstrates how to customize the way items are rendered in the TimeLine portion of the control in order to add additional 
custom elements by creating a custom TimeLineVisualizationBehavior for Silverlight and WPF. The example shows how to create Baseline 
objects in the Timeline of the control that represent the assigned resource to a specific task in the iteration. The iteration Baseline
 is a summary of all Tasks Baseline intervals.

[//]:
KeyWords: Baseline, customize, timeline, timelinevisualizationbehavior, task, summary, timeruler

Name: BoldParentTasks
Description:
Bold Column's text for summary tasks
This example demonstrates how to set a custom FontWeight to the text in the CellTemplate of the Columns in the control based on if the task has children tasks.

[//]:

Name: CellTemplateBasedOnType
Description:
Custom CellTemplate for tasks with children
This example demonstrates how to customize the CellTemplate base on the Tasks type. In the example in the CellTemplate the elements of the DataTemplate are customized based on the CanExpand property of the OriginalDataItem.

[//]:

Name: ConnectToDatabase
Description:
Connecting to Database 

This project demonstrates how to fetch data from database and populate the RadGanttView control with it. And then after modifying the gantt task, how to update the database accordingly.

[//]:

Name: CustomCellTemplates
Description:
Custom Cell Templates
This project describes how to create a custom CellTemplate, CellEditTemplate, CellHighlightTemplate and CellSelectionTemplate 
for the ColumnDefinitions in RadGanttView control for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:

Name: CustomDragReorderBehavior
Description:
Custom Drag Reorder Behavior
This example demonstrates how to restrict the drag reorder of some tasks in the control with the use of a custom GanttDragDropBehavior. The example is available for both SIlverlight and WPF.

[//]:
KeyWords: CustomDragReorderBehavior, tasks, restrict, ganttdragdropbehavior, drag, drop, behavior

Name: CustomGanttTaskWithStatus
Description:
Custom Gantt Task With Status
This example demonstrates how create custom GanttTask in order to add a Status property for each task for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:

Name: DependenciesEditing
Description:
Dependencies Editing
This project demonstrates how to create, edit and delete a dependency to a Task in the RadGanttView control using an RadAutoCompleteBox control for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:
KeyWords: DependenciesEditing, create, edit, delete, task, dependency, autocompletebox

Name: DragDropFromExternalSource
Description:
Drag Drop From External Source
This example demonstrates how to create drag and drop functionality between external controls and the GridView part of the control.

[//]:

Name: EventDoubleClick
Description:
Event Double Click
This example demonstrates how to create double click on each GanttTask in the timeline for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:

Name: ExpandCollapseViaHeader
Description:
Expand/Collapse CheckBox inside the Tree Column's Header
This example demonstrates how to add a CheckBox to the ContentTemplate of the ColumnHeaderContainer in order to expand and collapse the Tasks with sub Tasks in the control.

[//]:

Name: GridSorting
Description:
Grid Sorting
This example demonstrates how to sort ascending or descending the task source of the RadGanttView by clicking on the grid header. This example is for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:

Name: HolidayEvents
Description:
Global and National Holidays
This example demonstrates how to create a custom TimeLineVisualizationBehavior in order to render multiple containers in the TimeRuler of the control. In the example the containers represent national and global holidays of 2013.

[//]:
KeyWords: HolidayEvents, custom, timeline, timelinevisualizationbehavior, render, multiple, containers, timeruler

Name: ImportExportFromAndToMSProject
Description:
Import Export From And To MSProject
This example demonstrates how to import XML MS Project files into RadGanttView and export RadGanttView to MSProject using the COM Interop binary Microsoft.Office.Interop.MSProject.

**Important:** The Microsoft.Office.Interop.MSProject binary is a primary interop assembly that interoperate with existing COM types. Because of that you need to have MSProject installed on your computer in order to use the export functionality of the example. 

[//]:

Name: LockingDragDependenciesBehavior
Description:
Locking GanttDragDependenciesBehavior
This example demonstrates how to create a custom GanttDragDependenciesBehavior for the RadGanttView control in order to disable the creating of dependencies from and to specific tasks.

[//]:

Name: ModifiedTasks
Description:
Modified Tasks
This example demonstrates how to implement a solution for setting a tasks as 'dirty'. A dirty task is a task whose properties have changed their initial values. You should note that when creating dependencies between Tasks via dragging, only the destination Task will be marked as dirty.

[//]:

Name: NotAllowedTargetDropSlots
Description:
Not allowed drop target TimeRuler slots
This example demonstrates how to create a custom GanttDragDropBehavior in order to achieve a behavior where drag and drop is not allowed in specific time frame slots of the TimeRuler of the control.

[//]:

Name: PixelsToPixelLengthConversion
Description:
Pixels to PixelLength conversion
This example demonstrates how the conversion between real Pixels and the PixelLength property of the RadGanttView control is calculated. You can enter pixels (double) in the TextBlock and press enter or the convert button to convert those Pixels into PixelLength and instantly see the result in the RadGanttView control. The same could be done by entering PixelLength (TimeSpan) in the TextBlock.

[//]:

Name: PrintingAndExporting
Description:
Printing And Exporting
This example demonstrates how to print the RadGanttView control's GridView and Timeline area for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:

Name: PrintingAndExportingAdvanced
Description:
Printing And Exporting Advanced
This example demonstrates how to print the RadGanttView controls content to A4 format and lets you choose which area to be exported and if the Headers should be included. It also shows how to create a custom print preview dialog with the use of RadWindow that shows how the pages will look after printing.

[//]:
KeyWords: PrintingAndExportingAdvanced, a4, format, headers, custom, print, dialog, page

Name: ProjectDeadline
Description:
Project Deadline
This example demonstrates how to customize the way items are rendered in the TimeLine portion of the control and add additional custom elements by creating a custom TimeLineVisualizationBehavior for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:
KeyWords: ProjectDeadline, customize, container, add, render, timeline, custom, timelinevisualizationbehavior

Name: RecurringTask
Description:
'Recurring' task on mutiple rows
This project demonstrates how to create a 'recurring' Task in the RadGanttView control for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:

Name: SameRowRecurringTask
Description:
'Recurring' task on single row
This project demonstrates how to implement a 'recurring' Task in the RadGanttView control for Silverlight and WPF. The task which has recurrences is displayed on the same row and the drag and drop of its 'recurrences' disabled.

[//]:

Name: StartEndEventContainers
Description:
Start/End times EventContainers
This example demonstrates how to use custom EventContainer instances in order to display labels for the Start and End time of each GanttTask except the milestone task.

[//]:
KeyWords: StartEndEventContainers, custom, display, labels, ganttask, milestone

Name: SummariesVisibilityToggle
Description:
Summary task visibility toggle behavior
This example demonstrates how to achieve a behavior with which the Summary task is hidden when its inner children tasks are visible and visible when they are collapsed.

[//]:

Name: SummaryTaskConsistency
Description:
Summary Task Consistency
This example demonstrates how to achieve consistency between inner tasks and their parent Summary task. 
If a border's task Start/End property are changed the Summary task's Start/End properties will be updated accordingly.

This example is available for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:
KeyWords: SummaryTaskConsistency, inner, parent, update, stretch, shrink, start, end, change

Name: TaskDeadline
Description:
Task Deadline
This example demonstrates how to customize the way items are rendered in the TimeLine portion of the control and add additional custom elements by creating a custom TimeLineVisualizationBehavior for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:
KeyWords: TaskDeadline, customize, event, container, add, render, timeline, custom, timelinevisualizationbehavior

Name: TaskDeadlineProperty
Description:
Task Deadline Property
The example demonstrates how to use and customize the built-in Deadline property of the GanttTask.

[//]:

Name: TaskResources
Description:
Task with a Resource
This example demonstrates how to add a custom Resource property to the GanttTask and customize the way the tasks are rendered in the TimeLine, so that this Resource is displayed.

[//]:

Name: TaskSnappingDragDropAndResizeBehavior
Description:
Task snapping DragDrop and Resize behavior
This example demonstrates how to create a custom GanttDragDropBehavior and SchedulingResizeBehavior in order to create a Task snapping behaviors. In the example if you resize a task or drag it, its Start and End time will be snapped to 00:00.
The example is available for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:
KeyWords: TaskSnappingDragDropAndResizeBehavior, customize, custom, GanttDragDropBehavior, SchedulingResizeBehavior, snap

Name: TasksWithDifferentColors
Description:
Tasks With Different Colors
This example demonstrates how to color the tasks depending on a property of the task.

[//]:

Name: TimelineIntervalMarkers
Description:
How to extend the CurrentHour and interval indicators into the Timeline
This example demonstrates how to vertically extend the CurrentHourIndicator and the interval markers into the Timeline of the control.

More details explanation of the use approach could be found here:
- For WPF: http://www.telerik.com/help/wpf/radganttview-howto-customize-the-timeline.html
- For Silverlight: http://www.telerik.com/help/silverlight/radganttview-howto-customize-the-timeline.html

[//]:

Name: ZeroTaskLevelInitiallyCollapsed
Description:
Zero Task Level Initially Collapsed
This example demonstrates how to create a custom InitialExpandBehavior that will collapse the 'Big Iteration' task and expand its children tasks
The example is available for Silverlight and WPF.

[//]:
KeyWords: ZeroTaskLevelInitiallyCollapsed, initialexpandbehavior, big, iteration, expand, expandbehavior
